revised_title: The Structure and Function of the Membrana Tympani in the Ear
tldr: The author examines the structure and function of the membrana tympani in the ear, particularly in different animals. They discover that the membrana tympani has a muscular structure and plays a crucial role in hearing by varying the tension and adapting to different sounds. The author also describes the other parts of the ear and their functions, such as the malleus, incus, stapes, and the Eustachian tube.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
